repnme.cdata!: Uruguay - First Structural Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project supports the Government's Structural Adjustment
            and Recovery Program, a program designed to increase exports
            and promote domestic savings, so as to permit a recovery of
            economic growth and reduce unemployment while strengthening
            the country's creditworthiness. The main areas covered
            by the Government's program are: (i) strengthening the
            public sector's financial position and restructuring
            the social security system; (ii) improving public investment
            programming and implementation; (iii) taking measures to
            improve commercial bank and corporate finances; and (iv)
            promoting export growth through export incentives and import
            tariff reform. The foreign exchange provided under the loan
            will be used to finance essential imports, excluding luxury
            goods and military items.
